org.opendaylight.controller.sal.utils

Class Status

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.sal.utils.Status
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Status
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents the return object of the osgi service interfaces function calls. It contains a code StatusCode representing the result of the call and a string which describes a failure reason (if any) in human readable form.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Status

        public Status(StatusCode errorCode,
      java.lang.String description)
        Generates an instance of the Status class. This is used as return code for internal API2 function calls. This constructor allows to specify, beside the Status Code, a custom human readable description to add more information about the status.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - The status code. If passed as null, code will be stored as StatusCode.UNDEFINED
        description - The human readable description of the status. If passed as null, description will be inferred by the code

      • Status

        public Status(StatusCode errorCode)
        Generates an instance of the Status class based on the passed StatusCode only. The description field of the Status object will be inferred by the status code.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - The status code. If passed as null, code will be stored as StatusCode.UNDEFINED

      • Status

        public Status(StatusCode errorCode,
      long requestId)
        Generates an instance of the Status class to be used in case of asynchronous call. It is supposed to be created by the underlying infrastructure only when it was successful in allocating the asynchronous request id, hence caller should expect StatusCode to be successful.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - The status code. If passed as null, code will be stored as StatusCode.UNDEFINED
        requestId - The request id set by underlying infrastructure for this request

    • Method Detail

      • getCode

        public StatusCode getCode()
        Returns the status code
        Returns:
        the StatusCode representing the status code

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns a human readable description of the failure if any
        Returns:
        a string representing the reason of failure

      • isSuccess

        public boolean isSuccess()
        Tells whether the status is successful
        Returns:
        true if the Status code is StatusCode.SUCCESS

      • getRequestId

        public long getRequestId()
        Return the request id assigned by underlying infrastructure in case of asynchronous request. In case of synchronous requests, the returned id is expected to be 0
        Returns:
        The request id assigned for this asynchronous request
